# Introduction {.unnumbered}

PiRadar is a high-performance Python driver for the [Dreamhat](https://shop.pimoroni.com/products/dream-hat-plus-radar?variant=55529907290491) Raspberry Pi Radar hat, featuring the Infineon BGT60TR13C millimeter wave radar chip.

## Overview

This driver provides a comprehensive Python interface for the BGT60TR13C radar sensor, enabling:

- **Real-time Data Acquisition**: High-speed SPI communication at up to 50 MHz
- **Flexible Data Formats**: Export to NumPy arrays (.npy) or HDF5 files (.h5)
- **Network Streaming**: Real-time data streaming via ZeroMQ with async support
- **Adaptive Control**: Dynamic parameter adjustment for AI/ML applications
- **Production Ready**: Comprehensive error handling, logging, and testing

## Key Features

### High-Performance Data Collection

- Optimized SPI interface supporting up to 50 MHz clock speed
- Efficient frame buffer management with configurable FIFO parameters
- DMA-ready architecture for minimal CPU overhead
- Real-time streaming capabilities

### Flexible Configuration

- YAML-based configuration files with validation
- Support for legacy Infineon tool formats (.txt, .json)
- Runtime parameter modification
- Pre-configured profiles for common use cases

### Network Communication

- ZeroMQ-based bidirectional communication
- Async/await support for non-blocking operations
- Multiple port configuration (data, commands, status)
- Built-in serialization for NumPy arrays

### AI/ML Integration

- Direct register map access for learning algorithms
- Real-time parameter control via ZMQ backchannel
- Performance monitoring and change tracking
- Gym-like reinforcement learning environment
